title: Let Nocturne be Nocturne
body: Riot, can you please buff Nocturne's R range radius so Nocturne can be Nocturne again?

replies.body:

My problem with him is largely playing him when I'm playing with people I don't know.

"Nocturne is an assassin, you should be diving them!"

Ummm no, he has almost no burst at all, yes the tool tip labels him as an assassin, but he's the furthest thing from an assassin in that particular category of burst, he's more of a counter gank type of player or singling out an out of position player, which if you want to label him as an assassin from that standpoint, sure I could see that. Outside of that, nope, nothing. 

Seriously, the number of people who try to tell me the "proper" way to build him is ridiculous. He simply can not burst. Period. Even with some of the ridiculous builds I've heard of. 

I think his kit is fantastic, just allow his Q to let him move through terrain, increase the range on his ult, and suddenly, Nocturne will FEEL like Nocturne: a terrifying ethereal spirit whom you don't know where he will pop out next. 

And maybe with the change on the Q, the stupid item advisement that tells you to get a poacher's knife would make more sense (Nocturne, a counter-jungler? LMFAO.)

Could he become too powerful with those changes? I would argue no. His only gap-closer is still linked to his ultimate, and his Q is still going to be relatively the same in terms of damage output (so to speak.), the only thing that changes is his opportunities to make plays increase, which isn't a bad thing IMO.

If he does become too powerful, you could reduce his passive AS on his W, I know Riot is not a fan of hidden powers so that could definitely be a starting point for trading off power. 

And change his label as fighter for the love of god, sick of people in solo queue claiming he's capable of bursting. He's an assassin in the sense that if you're caught out against a proper Nocturne, you're screwed, but it seems the perception of assassin is high burst, not the ease of singling someone out of position easily, which is what Nocturne does, and what I think quite frankly, the assassin class should be revolving around.

He is somewhere in between assassin and fighter kind of like how tryndamere is. This is mostly from the fact that almost all of their damage comes from autoattacks, however, nocturne can't get away with building full damage like trynda cause he doesn't have an escape or ult like trynda.

Now he couldn't really do a whole lot in teamfight scenarios because he was too squishy, but when it came to his catch-out power it was godly.

I disagree.
I've been playing him since the very end of season 2 and I have to say Nocturne is a great assassin. He's just not faceroll like most  assassins are expected to be.

Sure his combo is only 1004_(280 of which is magic damage DoT and therefore much less useful, although still useful enough to be considered relevant)_ + (3.15*bonus AD),

But the advantage is that the majority of it happens instantaneously, leaving most targets only a few hits away from death.
Hits that Nocturne's varying steroids and sticking tools can easily let him throw.

Plus Critical strikes with his steroids get insane. 

.

The bigger problem with Nocturne ATM is that he just can't get enough gold in the current jungle to support a lot of bruiser builds, let alone assassin builds.

That's why I usually play him toplane; his steroids allow him to straight up overpower alot of champions and his spellshield lets deal with alot more (his passive also makes great harass early). There he can farm the gold needed to actually build the items he needs to assassinate properly, then he can roam easily mid-late laning phase using his ult.

.

Back to the main topic, I'd be hesitant be buff or nerf him because his steroids multiply each other and his spellshield, while underrated, makes him incredibly difficult to peel without multiple sources of easily hit CC.

Firstly, the concept of an assassin as purely a high burst character is specific to league, assassins are just characters that get in and duel/take out a high priority target. Let's assume nocturne is at level 8 with a warrior enchant skirmishers and a tiamat, he has .668 + 20% aspd, 137 ad, and 10 armor pen, not counting runes/masteries. His ult deals 150 (+164) damage, his q deals 240 (+103) damage, and his tiamat deals 82 damage.
192
Assuming the nocturne was smart and used his q midflight before his ult/tiamat connected, his q deals 343, his ult deals 432, and his tiamat deals 115 damage. Assuming he knows to throw in one auto, then tiamat for the reset, then auto again, his autos deal a total of 576 damage, regardless of his attack speed because of the cancel. This totals up to 1466 damage flat in less than a second after his q impacts. 

For this example, he'll be assassinating a level 8 jinx, who has 991 health and 43.1 armor (reduced to 33.1 by warrior pen), unmodified by runes/masteries. Jinx thereby reduces 30% of Nocs 1466 damage with her armor, to a total of 879.6 damage, reducing jinx from full hp to 111 health in less than a second. Noc can of course, aa 1-2 times (1 time if he applied e midflight or smited jinx) afterwards for the kill. I'd say that's some pretty significant burst.
you forgot to take his passive into account, so the AA-Tiamat-AA combo would be about 40 damage higher
almost no burst my butt.  all you have to do is build him right and he can burst pretty fast.

I've always disliked the "assassin consensus" A real assassin is not about burst, that is secondary, many champs have "burst" an assassin is about gap closing. it's about getting that target that thought they could escape. Ambushing from the darkness/brush. Having High damage in general and finishing off enemies. Nocturne is a fight assassin, in the sense that he can isolate and kill, or brawl a little. He is not an assassin fighter, or extremely high inescapable burst followed by the ability to stick around around kill everyone else (like a fed Zed - not saying he is OP, but he is a true assassin). 

tl;dr
An assassins "role" is to SECURE kills, with attacks that are almost unavoidable, or stealth/dashes to to get to the target, despite the other defences placed around them. In terms of Raw burst, that's the mages job, which is why champs like Vel or Anivia who can wreck an entire enemy team, work well with assassins like Kha or Katarina, who can clean up the scum as they flee. Not turret dive a full hp cc champ and expect to walkaway unharmed...

The only part that I disagree with is the whole diving thing, I've played Noct quite a few different ways, I feel like he's best built as an AD/AS on hit bruiser (similar to Irelia,) so that in a team fight you can followup after a tank goes in and soaks up some CC, dive the backline but be tanky enough to at the very least keep them busy for awhile.

The point that I, and most others will agree on is that he's likely best catching people out, preferably a carry before a fight.

Also I really, really want Dunkbringer to let me go through terrain, that would make him so fun.

I could see, with all of the recent mobility creep since the last time Riot touched his ult, a buff being fair. To be honest though, I don't have much trouble with it.

You get the burst assassinate by ulting (yes, save it for the kill, not for the initiation), and by Q'ing the ult-target before the ult hits them. The Duskbringer (Q) will hit the target before the Paranoia (R) does. Being on the Dusk Trail (Q) will raise your AD, amplifying your ult damage, then the automatic cleave procs, and that damage will also be amplified by being on the Dusk Trail (Q). Using Shroud of Darkness (W) and blocking a spell at the time all of this is happening doubles the passive AS bonus, allowing you to burst for the kill. Simply clicking R will not assassinate. It takes R+Q while on approach to the R target.
Quite frankly, I don't see the point, the range is good enough and he'd need to be nerfed in other areas (probs).

I used to love him, yeah, but it does just seem like he can't compete anymore.  It's so much safer and ultimately more rewarding to go with a bruiser type in the jungle slot. 

I really like the "Q allows him to go through terrain" idea, but the things that would really put him back in the game would be a lowered ulti cooldown at lower ranks, a small increase to ulti RANGE at the low and high end, and a bit of tether range. Everyone so tanky and mobile right now he just can't do it anymore. And he definitely doesn't "assassinate" anyone. He's got too little burst and he's too squish. He catches people out.
Should we bring him in the light of competitive play, or leave him in darkness?
